programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Wiltshire is the final bargain hunting location, where Margie Cooper hunts down a real mixed bag of offerings, from a large Edwardian shoe sign to an early 20th-century African thumb piano, while Ochuko Ojiri's heart is captured by a set of 1930s hat moulds. Who will come out on top at auction?

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Family and friends Vijai, Sheetal, Jyoti and Rajen compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Jermaine Jenas host the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances, rounding off the working week in style

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Commonwealth gold medal-winning gymnast Claudia Fragapane, former Premier League striker Carlton Cole, Superbike world champion James Toseland and Olympic badminton silver medallist Gail Emms join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Lucy Beaumont and Desiree Burch, Strictly judge Anton Du Beke and actor Ralf Little join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr join forces to renovate the last two rooms. Their dream of creating an open plan living and dining room is dented when they discover the main structural wall dividing the two spaces requires a much smaller arch than they anticipated. For this final space, they agree to put their design differences to one side, but a disagreement over the shape of the arch threatens to divide them. Away from the task, the duo take a boat trip along the stunning Zingaro nature reserve to get inspiration from the Sicilian landscape, and enjoy sunset on horseback in the ancient Greek city of Selinunte

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Following Neville's arrest on suspicion of killing David Cartwright, DI Karen Flitcroft from the Department of Policing Standards arrives to investigate. CCTV footage shows an agitated Neville visiting the victim shortly before he was found dead, which as far as Flitcroft is concerned proves his guilt - so she advises the team members that if they are convinced of their inspector's innocence, they must prove it quickly. Robert Webb guests stars in the crime drama, with Ralf Little

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Judi Dench talks about her heart-warming film Allelujah, while Paul Rudd and Michael Douglas - stars of Marvel's Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania - also pop in for a chat. Greatest Showman Hugh Jackman talks about his role in The Son, a powerful drama about fatherhood, Michael B Jordan promotes boxing sequel Creed III, while Eugene Levy discusses his new TV series The Reluctant Traveller. Plus, there's music from P!nk, who performs her new single Trustfall

programme.title: Magic Mike (2012)
programme.desc: A male stripper who is the star attraction in a nightclub teaches a talented young dancer the tricks of the trade, while also introducing him to his hedonistic world. The veteran performer falls for his protege's sister, but finds his wild lifestyle comes between them. Steven Soderbergh's comedy drama, with Channing Tatum, Matthew McConaughey, Olivia Munn and Alex Pettyfer

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by actor Jason Watkins and fellow chefs Vivek Singh and Shivi Ramoutar. Helen McGinn chooses the wines to go with the studio dishes and there are clips from the BBC food archive featuring Rick Stein, Marcus Wareing, Nigella Lawson and Keith Floyd

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Chef Nick Nairn and presenter Dougie Vipond go al fresco, making smoked fish scotch eggs with a chunky salad. Singer and actress Clare Grogan joins them in the kitchen to chat and try out the delicious food and drink combination

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott looks ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Nottingham Forest v Manchester City. Plus, news from the lunchtime match between Aston Villa and Arsenal

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning hosts the show from Belfast and pays a visit to one of the city's most famous bars. Ben Cooper and Charles Hanson assist the teams in finding a bargain

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore unearths a pair of floral chairs, a chipboard chest of drawers and a collection of antique hardware from the rubbish heap, hoping to breathe new life into them and make some cash for the original owners

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin takes in the delights of Derbyshire with a couple from Leeds who are keen to see a range of properties with all the trimmings. Jonnie also visits a local cafe where customers take household items to be repaired rather throwing them away

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Actress and comedian Debra Stephenson, journalist and broadcaster James O'Brien, comedian and writer Shaparak Khorsandi and hairstylist Sam McKnight are in the famous black chair, answering questions on John Lennon, the books of JD Salinger, the adventures of Asterix and 1970s disco music

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees comedians Susan Calman, John Thomson, Jon Culshaw and Shazia Mirza taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Show
programme.desc: Michael presents another hour of entertainment, featuring Ellie Goulding singing Like a Saviour, Jermaine Jenas handing over his mobile in Send to All and a duet from the two Unexpected Stars of the Show. Plus, a contestant on The Wheel gets the surprise of her life when her edition keep getting more bizarre

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Sheila Ferguson, Glenn Moore, Roxy Shahidi, Sonia, Dave Berry, Manish Bhasin, Katherine Dow Blyton and Richie Anderson step up to the podiums in an effort to find the least likely correct answers in this celebrity edition. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Dylan clashes with an old rival, Robyn and Paul make a life-changing decision, and Stevie seeks comfort from Marcus

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Aston Villa v Arsenal at Villa Park and Nottingham Forest v Manchester City at the City Ground and Newcastle United v Liverpool at St James' Park. Arsenal and City will both have expected three points on their travels to aid them in their respective title challenges, while the Magpies were looking for revenge after Liverpool inflicted a rare defeat upon them in the reverse fixture. Plus, Brentford v Crystal Palace, Brighton & Hove Albion v Fulham, Chelsea v Southampton, Everton v Leeds United and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Bournemouth

programme.title: The Lost Boys (1987)
programme.desc: Two teenage brothers move with their mother to a coastal town in California, where the eldest falls in with a local biker gang. He soon discovers that his new friends are vampires and he is turning into one himself, forcing his younger brother to team up with a pair of heavily armed comic shop employees to battle the undead and save his soul. Comedy horror, starring Kiefer Sutherland, Jason Patric, Dianne Wiest, Corey Feldman and Corey Haim

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie and Ochuko travel along the Welsh border searching for antiques to sell at auction. Margie finds a Victorian oak barrel, noting the craftsman who made such containers are called 'coopers' she hopes her namesake will bring her luck. Ochuko finds an eclectic mix of items, a mirror, an American money box and some Danish egg cups are amongst the treasures he finds but what really catches his eye is some Sheffield silver

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Joe, Liz, Jamie and Nichola compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: Butcher's assistant Natalie from Richmondshire takes the group to one of the most famous spots on Yorkshire's stunning coastline, Robin Hood's Bay

programme.title: Tom Kerridge: Lose Weight for Good
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, the chef takes the group of dieters on a river cruise to celebrate their weight loss over the past 12 weeks. Tom prepares a selection of sharing dishes for the special occasion, including couscous, griddled halloumi and Mediterranean vegetables, pulled pork tacos with salad, and falafels with a tzatziki dip

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Ore Oduba in which contestants have to answer questions to get as far along a track as they can before a ball catches and passes them, ending their go

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Gardeners in Goring-on-Thames, Oxfordshire, aim to transform the train station, brighten up the pathway to the high street and fill the village with hanging baskets

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: The barristers return to their investigation of a curious case, a poultry farmer who buried the body of his fiancée under a chicken run, but claimed to be innocent of her murder

programme.title: Animals with Cameras
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan leads a team using specially designed on-board cameras to film groundbreaking new behaviour in some of the animals who depend on our oceans. In Cape Verde, Gordon starts the adventure with a look at one of the world's largest populations of nesting loggerhead turtles, before heading to the Bahamas with Caribbean reef sharks

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: A visit to Exeter Livestock Market, the biggest agricultural auction in the region, where a team of auctioneers can sell more than 3,000 animals in a day

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At the City Hall in Kingston upon Hull, antiques experts Caroline Hawley and David Harper hunt for objects to take to auction. Caroline is entertained by the story behind some Laurel and Hardy autographs and David is gripped by a collection of postcards between young lovers from the Edwardian era. Presenter Paul Martin talks to playwright James Graham about the legacy of Hull's year as the UK's City of Culture

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Anna Richardson, Tom Rosenthal and Sindhu Vee test their skills in a variety of trivia-based games, with the ultimate winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef glimpses life in Cornwall 2,000 years ago as he explores the atmospheric ruins of the ancient village of Carn Euny. Rick also cooks his favourite Sunday lunch, a hearty steak and kidney pudding, and goes for a bracing ride on a beautiful hand-built boat

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a factory tucked away in the village of Wollaston, Northamptonshire, that has been a key player in the boot making business for 120 years, producing boots for policemen and pop stars alike, and follows every step of production of a pair of Dr Martens original 1460 leather boots. Cherry Healey gets to grips with the speedy machines that use 350 metres of yarn to make a single pair of shoe laces, while historian Ruth Goodman reveals the story of a British shoemaker that elevated ladies' shoes from risqué music hall performers of the 19th century to gracing the feet of the Queen of England

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest-scoring chefs from Wales must go head-to-head and cook their six-course menus again. They need to impress Marcus Wareing, Nisha Katona, and Ed Gamble. There's also the guest judge, TV presenter Gethin Jones, who spent his life around animation at S4C before moving to Blue Peter. How will he judge dishes inspired by British animation and illustration and Paddington's 65th birthday?

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Louis supports the rebel colonies in America against France's old enemy, England, despite misgivings at court. Though still with no son, Antoinette moves to the Petite Trianon, where life is less formal. Then a face from the past, Swedish noble Count Fersen, arrives, complicating matters

programme.title: QI XS
programme.desc: A selection of classic clips from QI where things seem to be getting out of control. Sandi Toksvig hosts

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: Tom Allen interviews the show's freshly rejected candidate, who reveals what it is really like to be in the firing line. Studio guests also discuss their views on what has happened in this week's episode

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Mark Urban

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: HMS Queen Elizabeth continues her journey to the South China Sea, but rampant Covid on board means she is not allowed to come ashore for any of the planned port visits. Sailing past Singapore and Hong Kong, the ship has become a floating prison, isolated on the high seas. Her dedicated supply ships do their best to keep the Queen Elizabeth topped up with food, fuel and ammunition. As the QE and her escorting destroyers and frigates enter the contested and potentially dangerous waters of the South China Sea, the Chinese Navy react by probing her with submarines and surface warships. Anti-submarine helicopters launch continually in order to identify, track and see off the subsurface threat

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: A 17-year-old who developed scoliosis in adolescence has surgery to correct his extremely curved spine. But the procedure has its risks as the spinal cord is at the centre of the vertebrae where the surgeons must operate. The Addenbrooke's team also welcome a 75 -year-old woman who is having an operation to help with her bladder control

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk help Helen and daughter Ruth in Leicestershire to declutter Helen's parent's home so she can move in her family of nine. They sort through generations of heirlooms and antiques picking out the best ones to sell at their pop-up auction in Stafford Castle

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: On its way to the far Pacific, HMS Queen Elizabeth ventures into the eastern Mediterranean. Britain's biggest warship is exercising its rights of navigation in international waters, but almost immediately Russian warships are diverted from the Black Sea to intercept it, while. Russian fighter bombers are also scrambled from their base in Syria to buzz the British task force and a tense stand-off unfolds

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Ochuko Ojiri head to Worcestershire, where items that grab their attention include 19th-century porcelain, 1970s modern art and Margie's favourite stuff - silver

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Best friends Néamh, Ollie, Rosa and Nathan compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: As the land recovers the action now centres on the river, where the bonds of kinship are tested to their limits. Kali the lioness is separated from her cubs in a spectacular hunt and the baby lions find themselves trapped in a bend in a river, with hooves thundering all around them. Chubby baby hippo Mafuta learns to survive in his riverine home, although just staying afloat is a challenge for this newborn - and Magamba the crocodile also has him in her sights

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Contestants answer questions to get as far as they can along a track before a ball catches and passes them, ending their go. Quiz, hosted by Ore Oduba

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Chris Bavin heads to northern Lincolnshire to meet the volunteers from Immingham in Bloom. They've been taking part in Britain In Bloom for seven years and have won gold before. However, this time the group is upping the ante by taking a huge risk. Chris finds out how they plan to retain their crown by including the port itself in their entry, with plans to brighten this enormous grey industrial area with colourful flowers

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein revisit the savage murder of a pub landlady in a sleepy Oxfordshire hamlet in 1922, which led to the unlikely conviction of a 15-year-old boy

programme.title: Animals with Cameras
programme.desc: Chris Watts works with biologists and researchers to develop bespoke cameras tough enough for the Australian landscape, withstanding the heat and the height that the animals have to live with. In New South Wales, Gordon encounters a marsupial facing a complex set of challenges when he meets a population of kangaroos that are being pushed to the very brink by a coastal development boom

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: Cameras explore Brixham's Fish Market in Devon, where auctioneers John Rogers and Todd Crombie start at 4am every week day. Stephen Tompkinson narrates

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At the City Hall in Kingston upon Hull, Caroline Hawley uncovers a remarkable collection of suffragette postcards and David Harper is delighted by some Hull Daily Mail newspaper printing blocks, saved from the tip. Presented by Paul Martin

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Anna Richardson, Tom Rosenthal and Sindhu Vee go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games for the final time, prior to the week's overall winner being declared

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef witnesses a fishing method frozen in time, where the use of engines and winches is banned, and goes fishing under sail for what he considers to be the best oysters in the world. Back on dry land, Rick cooks a warming fish soup called Cullen Skink, and discovers the all-but-forgotten story of Cornwall's ancient capital, Lostwithiel

programme.title: Cornwall with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the conclusion of his two-part journey, Simon investigates the environmental challenges facing Cornwall and the rest of the country. He discovers how the region's farmers are adopting new, less intensive approaches that are both more profitable and environmentally friendly, and reveals how reintroducing beavers to the uplands could tackle the problem of widespread flooding. He also encounters some of the county's iconic wildlife, including grey seals that live in constant risk of getting caught up in discarded fishing nets

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the first of four compilation programmes, Monty Don harvests tomatoes from the greenhouse and plants out some of his favourite flowers, for long-lasting summer colour, heleniums. Plus, Carol Klein pays an inspirational trip to an early summer garden in Wiltshire, and Toby Buckland meets a woman in Devon who has created and nurtured her garden over the last 60 years

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: An extended version of the quiz with Sandi Toksvig, Alan Davies, Rosie Jones, Ahir Shah and Henning Wehn discussing tea time. But will any of the panellists fall into those traps?

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Return of the stand-up comedy showcase recorded at the Hammersmith Apollo, welcoming an array of established and up-and-coming stand-ups to the stage. In the first edition, host Chris McCausland introduces sets by Sophie Duker and Emmanuel Sonubi

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Mark Urban

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Documentary about the world of relationship counselling. Ping and Will navigate the challenges of an open relationship. Molly wonders whether her marriage to Josh can withstand their 'scar tissue'

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Ping traces her problems with Will to a recent trip he took. Cyn opens up about a childhood trauma. India lashes out against feelings of judgment by Dale

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Fact-based comedy drama following the exploits of a wealthy landowner who decides to leave his life behind and become a pirate. Starring Rhys Darby

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts spends a year visiting archaeological digs around the country, finding out about discoveries that shed new light on British history during the prehistoric, Roman, Saxon and Tudor eras

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: A report on the devastating 7.8 magnitude earthquake that stuck Turkey and Syria on February 6, 2023, killing tens of thousands of people. With the help of teams from BBC Turkish and BBC Arabic, the programme follows survivors and rescue workers from both sides of the border, and asks if could more have been done to save lives

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Becoming King initially paralyses Louis, and Marie is drawn into the tussle over the choice of prime minister. The glittering celebratory ball she holds makes her the centre of attention, against protocols. Marie is targeted by paper 'doves' spreading scandal. Unaware how wounded her husband's pride has become, she learns the hard way when anger erupts. Drama, starring Emilia Schüle

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Blackbeard decides to try his hand at being an aristocrat, so his crew assume new identities to accompany him to a fancy party. While the captain relishes his new alter-ego, Jeff, Oluwande and Frenchie devise a scheme to get rich quick. Back on the ship, Izzy attempts to punish Lucius

programme.desc: The squirrels have to climb a mountain to save Enid

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels discover the world of accessorising

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Chilli tries to be a superhero

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Pumpkins mysteriously disappear one after another, leaving nothing but a trail of slime

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: The pair accidentally do good deeds for the people of Beanotown and go on a 'helping rampage', leaving a wake of mayhem behind them

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Dog invents a gadget that helps him play fetch alone, but this makes Mouse jealous

programme.title: The Football Academy
programme.desc: It is a big week for striker Nick and the rest of the U-15s team as they travel to Loughborough to take part in the Premier League Nationals tournament

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Zoe wants a space so she can carry out messy, noisy science experiments out of earshot of her dad, who works nights

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: A look at why the human body is mostly made of water as the doctors investigate the hypothalamus, the amazing part of the brain that keeps the body hydrated

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Mwaksy heads to Sweden for a look around Minecraft HQ with the lucky winner of the Create Something Great competition

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall takes a four-day journey to Bird Island, a sub-Antarctic landmass home to wildlife including the wandering albatross - which has the largest wingspan of any bird - and giant petrels and skuas. The presenter also dives with fur seals in the freezing waters

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Bakari and the rest of the baboons can see no escape when the lions take over their home - until the pride fall asleep. Baby hippo Mafuta's mother tries to keep the crocodiles from desecrating his dead father's body - but in the ensuing chaos the youngster is swept away down the river. Crocodile Magamba defends her hatchlings and Duma the cheetah struggles to make friends

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Four years after the Daniels family moved into their home there are still moving boxes left unopened in the garage leaving little room for the family of five. Stacey, with the help of organiser Dilly, carpenter Rob and cleaner Iwan, puts all their belongings on display in a warehouse for them to see just how much unnecessary clutter they have including 492 DVDs, 35 happy birthday banners, 12 unopened chandeliers and 905 items of baby clothing

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef returns to champion more of the food, history and culture of the county. He begins by foraging for mussels in his favourite rock pools, and touring Bodmin Moor's dark past with his son Jack. He also cooks a fool-proof souffle with artisan Cornish goat's cheese

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives, focusing on dishes that all have something of a kick to them

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Action from Bathurst, Australia, as the event took place for the first time since 2019 after being postponed on several occasions due to the Covid-19 pandemic

programme.title: How the West Was Won (1962)
programme.desc: Three generations of a pioneering family experience many ordeals and adventures in their endeavour to build a new life for themselves on the American frontier in the 19th century. Over the years, the family experiences the key events of the nation's history, including the gold rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads. Western, starring James Stewart, John Wayne, Gregory Peck, Henry Fonda, Debbie Reynolds, Lee J Cobb and Richard Widmark

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and experts Christina Trevanion and Will Axon travel to the Oxford Union, where they pick out antiques and collectibles to be sold at a local auction - including an autograph book and some etchings by a famous artist. Plus, the presenter goes behind the scenes at the venue, to discover which famous faces debated in the chamber

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Consumer journalists Nikki Fox and Matt Allwright hunt for antiques in Kent alongside expert guides Natasha Raskin Sharp and David Harper. As they seek out items to sell at auction, the rookie antiques dealers find the time to learn about William Morris's manifesto to save ancient buildings, and discover the connection between Kentish ragstone and the early Victorian dinosaur hunters

programme.title: Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox begins his epic exploration of the cosmos, beginning with the great luminous bodies that bring light and warmth to the universe, the stars. Throughout the opening episode, he looks at how stars created life and meaning in the cosmos, from the dawn of time through to the arrival of our own star, the Sun

programme.title: Gravity (2013)
programme.desc: Two astronauts are left stranded in orbit above the Earth when the debris from an exploding satellite destroys their shuttle. Left drifting in space with no way to contact mission control, they begin a perilous journey to reach the safety of a space station before their oxygen supply runs out. Thriller, starring Sandra Bullock and George Clooney

programme.title: Movie Themes at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the best BBC moments and classic archives performances from singers and bands who cracked Hollywood as well as the pop charts. With songs from blockbusters, Oscar-winners, comedies and family favourites featuring a selection soundtrack stars, including Destiny's Child, Paul Simon, All Saints, Simple Minds and Dolly Parton

programme.title: ... Sings Bond
programme.desc: A selection of performances of the Bond theme tunes across the years, including Adele's Skyfall and archive clips of Shirley Bassey's Diamonds Are Forever, Tina Turner's GoldenEye, Tom Jones's Thunderball and Matt Monro's From Russia with Love. Plus, hits by Fun Lovin' Criminals, Sheena Easton, Lulu, Garbage, a-ha and others

programme.title: Moonstruck (1987)
programme.desc: An Italian-American widow agrees to marry an older man - only to fall head over heels in love with his younger brother, leaving her facing an impossible choice. Romantic comedy, starring Cher in an Oscar-winning role, with Nicolas Cage, Olympia Dukakis and Danny Aiello

programme.title: Cher at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of the singer's performances on BBC programmes, including Believe, Love and Understanding, and Walking in Memphis, as well as her first UK chart-topper I Got You Babe, recorded with ex-husband and singing partner Sonny Bono

programme.title: The Lighthouse (2016)
programme.desc: Two men are assigned to keep a lighthouse on an island in the Irish sea in 1801. A freak storm cuts the island off from the mainland for months on end, and the isolation drives both men to the brink of madness, with devastating consequences. Fact-based thriller, starring Mark Lewis Jones and Michael Jibson

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Pontyclun to Ebbw Vale in Wales. Along the way, he visits the Royal Mint in Llantrisant and Cardiff Arms Park, scene of the first Welsh victory over the All Blacks back in 1905. In Cardiff Bay, Michael discovers the departure point for one of the Edwardian era's most famous expeditions - Scott's ill-fated voyage to the Antarctic

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross paints a beautiful monochromatic scene with delicate leafless trees and a rich grassy meadow surrounding a sweet cottage

programme.title: Queen Victoria's Letters: A Monarch Unveiled
programme.desc: Part one of two. Examining the first half of Queen Victoria's life, biographer AN Wilson goes in search of a monarch too often misunderstood as the solid black-clad matron, and reveals a woman who was passionately romantic and who spent her years as a child and young queen fighting the control of domineering men. Queen Victoria's journals and letters are read by Anna Chancellor throughout

programme.title: Dark Waters (2019)
programme.desc: When a defence attorney takes on a lawsuit case against a chemical company, he finds a deep and rich trial in their history that unravels a history of pollution. Drama, starring Mark Ruffalo, Anne Hathaway, Tim Robbins, Bill Pullman and Bill Camp

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Infinity (2015)
programme.desc: The story of the life and academic career of the pioneering Indian mathematician, Srinivasa Ramanujan, and his friendship with his mentor at Trinity College, Cambridge, Professor GH Hardy. Biographical drama, starring Jeremy Irons, Dev Patel and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank visits Mali and Egypt, where he examines masks said to connect the land of the living with that of the dead, admires the paintings of the Dogon, and learns the story of reputedly the most beautiful woman in history. He also explores the Great Pyramid, then journeys across the desert of Libya before concluding this leg of the expedition with a trip down the Nile

programme.title: Boy George and Culture Club: Karma to Calamity
programme.desc: A look at the history of the band, examining its rise to fame, eventual disintegration and the personalities within the group who made it such a success in the early 1980s. Director Mike Nicholls follows the band members as they meet in singer Boy George's London home to write new material following their decision to reunite in 2014

programme.title: Radio 2 in Concert
programme.desc: One of the most representative and influential bands of the 1980s, Boy George and Culture Club rose to fame in the early 1980s with an illustrious music career now spanning five decades. This intimate show, recorded at the BBC Radio Theatre in London, features such classic tunes as Karma Chameleon and Do You Really Want to Hurt Me?, as well as songs from their 2018 album Life

programme.title: The New Romantics: A Fine Romance
programme.desc: A look back at legends of the New Romantic era of the early 1980s, when outrageous fashions and make-up ruled the roost thanks to the influence of performers including Duran Duran, Spandau Ballet and Boy George. Narrated by Magenta Devine, with contributors including Boy George, Gary Kemp, Adam Ant, Nick Rhodes, Steve Strange, Rusty Egan, Marilyn, Jonathan Ross, Caryn Franklin, Fiona Bruce and Robert Elms

programme.title: Stewart Copeland's Adventures in Music
programme.desc: The performer continues his mission to understand how music works by exploring its extraordinary power to tell stories. His journey includes meetings with film director Francis Ford Coppola, who explains how simple musical devices transformed the most famous scenes in The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, Sting, who describes the secrets of his song-writing process, rapper Talib Kweli, who looks at the power of music in protest, and the French-Cuban Ibeyi sisters, who show how music has kept the Yoruban tradition alive

Round one is fancy fashion foodies, and everyone loves Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny, so Love Monster thinks he can just pick her. Then it is round two - the veggie variety show. Everyone loves the In-Chicks, so Love Monster now has to choose between them and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. Then it is the final round, which is the tantalizing taste test of home grown goodies, and this time everyone loves Bad Idea Puppy. Tinks fetches Charli’s hair brush so Charli can brush her newly-dyed pink hair, and then helps Charli choose a party outfit. And, when Charli can’t find her keys, Tinks dives into a mountain of clothes on the bed to search for them. Now they’re party ready, but it's raining! programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monster’s small kite doesn’t seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. Elder Panda is disappointed but he does understand, as he too wanted to fly before he could run, but sometimes you have to start small before going big.

There’s a big match tomorrow, and Rayane really wants to be picked for the team. It’s the summer holidays, so Rayane and Diesel have been sleeping in. Diesel needs to be on high alert! Diesel’s superears are trained to alert Rayane to important sounds he might miss. Diesel is Rayane’s ears! In the morning, Diesel must filter out all the noises in the house and listen for Dad calling Rayane for breakfast. Rayane is being picked up for the football match by his friend Karim, so Diesel has to listen out for the knock at the door. Will his superhearing help him filter out all the other sounds and make sure that Rayane gets to his football trial on time?

Xuli and Lars take a secret tunnel to the arts and craft room to make the decorations, while Foz, Kyan and Glitch head out into the Academy garden to gather Ubercorn’s favourite flowers, cherry blossoms. programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The remaining candidates are tasked to design a new lunchbox aimed at six-to-eight-year-olds, along with an app to encourage healthy eating. programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Satirist, presenter and producer Munya Chawawa, comedian Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and radio presenter Snoochie Shy join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Father Brown discovers there's more drama offstage than on in the latest production by the Kembleford Players. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.desc: Friends Neil and Kai started their chilli farm in 2019 and now grow over 500 pesticide-free plants in their Wye Valley polytunnels. Here, they launch their new chilli ice-cream at Abergavenny Food Festival. Kevin and Natalie also get customers' taste buds tingling with their award-winning Welsh cider, perry and apple juice. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A desire to move closer to family and the need for a new single-storey home is fuelling today's buyers to make the move from Birmingham to the Lincolnshire countryside. Jules Hudson is there to help the couple navigate the property market in the county, where he also finds out what a difference nearly 60 years has made in tractor technology

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Wiltshire is the final bargain hunting location, where Margie Cooper hunts down a real mixed bag of offerings, from a large Edwardian shoe sign to an early 20th-century African thumb piano, while Ochuko Ojiri's heart is captured by a set of 1930s hat moulds. programme.title: Life on the Bay
programme.desc: It is the biggest weekend of the year for newly promoted Laura Wallace, as the new Entertainments Manager has not one, but two sell-out shows, and her team need to pull out all the stops to turn the venue around in time. The Burntisland Highland Games are back on the Bay after a three-year break, and Andrew and John take a dance down memory lane

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Lucy Beaumont and Desiree Burch, Strictly judge Anton Du Beke and actor Ralf Little join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr join forces to renovate the last two rooms. Their dream of creating an open plan living and dining room is dented when they discover the main structural wall dividing the two spaces requires a much smaller arch than they anticipated. For this final space, they agree to put their design differences to one side, but a disagreement over the shape of the arch threatens to divide them. Away from the task, the duo take a boat trip along the stunning Zingaro nature reserve to get inspiration from the Sicilian landscape, and enjoy sunset on horseback in the ancient Greek city of Selinunte

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Following Neville's arrest on suspicion of killing David Cartwright, DI Karen Flitcroft from the Department of Policing Standards arrives to investigate. CCTV footage shows an agitated Neville visiting the victim shortly before he was found dead, which as far as Flitcroft is concerned proves his guilt - so she advises the team members that if they are convinced of their inspector's innocence, they must prove it quickly. Robert Webb guests stars in the crime drama, with Ralf Little

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Judi Dench talks about her heart-warming film Allelujah, while Paul Rudd and Michael Douglas - stars of Marvel's Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania - also pop in for a chat. Greatest Showman Hugh Jackman talks about his role in The Son, a powerful drama about fatherhood, Michael B Jordan promotes boxing sequel Creed III, while Eugene Levy discusses his new TV series The Reluctant Traveller. Plus, there's music from P!nk, who performs her new single Trustfall

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Commonwealth gold medal-winning gymnast Claudia Fragapane, former Premier League striker Carlton Cole, Superbike world champion James Toseland and Olympic badminton silver medallist Gail Emms join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: A View from the Terrace
programme.desc: Craig G Telfer, Craig Fowler, Shaughan McGuigan, Robert Borthwick and Joel Sked present a sideways look at Scottish football, dissecting of ins and outs of the week's action, with a variety of features covering the full spectrum from the giants to the minnows

programme.title: Magic Mike (2012)
programme.desc: A male stripper who is the star attraction in a nightclub teaches a talented young dancer the tricks of the trade, while also introducing him to his hedonistic world. The veteran performer falls for his protege's sister, but finds his wild lifestyle comes between them. Steven Soderbergh's comedy drama, with Channing Tatum, Matthew McConaughey, Olivia Munn and Alex Pettyfer

programme.title: Race to Disaster - The Ards TT
programme.desc: From 1928 to 1936 the Ards TT attracted Asian royalty, Italian icons and even notorious convicts to race their priceless machines through the streets of County Down. Half a million spectators would watch on as Sir Malcolm Campbell, Rudi Carraciola and Tazio Nuvolari drove for up to six hours through Newtownards and Comber on the narrow bumpy roads. Year on year speeds increased, and in 1936 a car driven by Belfastman Jack Chambers ploughed into spectators. Using rare archive footage, Mark Thompson reveals the story of the Ards TT, ultimately one of tragedy

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Neil 'Razor' Ruddock checks in to the B&B. Host Sharon and chef Alex want to give the footballing legend the opportunity to learn more about the local produce, so Alex takes him to Glenarm Castle's Estate to meet their herd of Shorthorn cattle. Armed with a rack of Shorthorn ribs, they have no excuse than to create a delicious dinner for the whole B&B team. Knowing Razor might need to brush up on his Northern Irish history, Sharon takes him to Londonderry for a little lesson. Famous for its intact 17th-century walls, the city is one of the few in Europe that never saw its fortifications breached

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Lucy Beaumont and Desiree Burch, Strictly judge Anton Du Beke and actor Ralf Little join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr join forces to renovate the last two rooms. Their dream of creating an open plan living and dining room is dented when they discover the main structural wall dividing the two spaces requires a much smaller arch than they anticipated. For this final space, they agree to put their design differences to one side, but a disagreement over the shape of the arch threatens to divide them. Away from the task, the duo take a boat trip along the stunning Zingaro nature reserve to get inspiration from the Sicilian landscape, and enjoy sunset on horseback in the ancient Greek city of Selinunte

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Following Neville's arrest on suspicion of killing David Cartwright, DI Karen Flitcroft from the Department of Policing Standards arrives to investigate. CCTV footage shows an agitated Neville visiting the victim shortly before he was found dead, which as far as Flitcroft is concerned proves his guilt - so she advises the team members that if they are convinced of their inspector's innocence, they must prove it quickly. Robert Webb guests stars in the crime drama, with Ralf Little

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Judi Dench talks about her heart-warming film Allelujah, while Paul Rudd and Michael Douglas - stars of Marvel's Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania - also pop in for a chat. Greatest Showman Hugh Jackman talks about his role in The Son, a powerful drama about fatherhood, Michael B Jordan promotes boxing sequel Creed III, while Eugene Levy discusses his new TV series The Reluctant Traveller. Plus, there's music from P!nk, who performs her new single Trustfall

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Commonwealth gold medal-winning gymnast Claudia Fragapane, former Premier League striker Carlton Cole, Superbike world champion James Toseland and Olympic badminton silver medallist Gail Emms join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Magic Mike (2012)
programme.desc: A male stripper who is the star attraction in a nightclub teaches a talented young dancer the tricks of the trade, while also introducing him to his hedonistic world. The veteran performer falls for his protege's sister, but finds his wild lifestyle comes between them. Steven Soderbergh's comedy drama, with Channing Tatum, Matthew McConaughey, Olivia Munn and Alex Pettyfer

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by actor Jason Watkins and fellow chefs Vivek Singh and Shivi Ramoutar. Helen McGinn chooses the wines to go with the studio dishes and there are clips from the BBC food archive featuring Rick Stein, Marcus Wareing, Nigella Lawson and Keith Floyd

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Chef Nick Nairn and presenter Dougie Vipond go al fresco, making smoked fish scotch eggs with a chunky salad. Singer and actress Clare Grogan joins them in the kitchen to chat and try out the delicious food and drink combination

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott looks ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Nottingham Forest v Manchester City. Plus, news from the lunchtime match between Aston Villa and Arsenal

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning hosts the show from Belfast and pays a visit to one of the city's most famous bars. Ben Cooper and Charles Hanson assist the teams in finding a bargain

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore unearths a pair of floral chairs, a chipboard chest of drawers and a collection of antique hardware from the rubbish heap, hoping to breathe new life into them and make some cash for the original owners

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin takes in the delights of Derbyshire with a couple from Leeds who are keen to see a range of properties with all the trimmings. Jonnie also visits a local cafe where customers take household items to be repaired rather throwing them away

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Actress and comedian Debra Stephenson, journalist and broadcaster James O'Brien, comedian and writer Shaparak Khorsandi and hairstylist Sam McKnight are in the famous black chair, answering questions on John Lennon, the books of JD Salinger, the adventures of Asterix and 1970s disco music

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees comedians Susan Calman, John Thomson, Jon Culshaw and Shazia Mirza taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Show
programme.desc: Michael presents another hour of entertainment, featuring Ellie Goulding singing Like a Saviour, Jermaine Jenas handing over his mobile in Send to All and a duet from the two Unexpected Stars of the Show. Plus, a contestant on The Wheel gets the surprise of her life when her edition keep getting more bizarre

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Sheila Ferguson, Glenn Moore, Roxy Shahidi, Sonia, Dave Berry, Manish Bhasin, Katherine Dow Blyton and Richie Anderson step up to the podiums in an effort to find the least likely correct answers in this celebrity edition. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Dylan clashes with an old rival, Robyn and Paul make a life-changing decision, and Stevie seeks comfort from Marcus

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Aston Villa v Arsenal at Villa Park and Nottingham Forest v Manchester City at the City Ground and Newcastle United v Liverpool at St James' Park. Arsenal and City will both have expected three points on their travels to aid them in their respective title challenges, while the Magpies were looking for revenge after Liverpool inflicted a rare defeat upon them in the reverse fixture. Plus, Brentford v Crystal Palace, Brighton & Hove Albion v Fulham, Chelsea v Southampton, Everton v Leeds United and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Bournemouth

programme.title: The Lost Boys (1987)
programme.desc: Two teenage brothers move with their mother to a coastal town in California, where the eldest falls in with a local biker gang. He soon discovers that his new friends are vampires and he is turning into one himself, forcing his younger brother to team up with a pair of heavily armed comic shop employees to battle the undead and save his soul. Comedy horror, starring Kiefer Sutherland, Jason Patric, Dianne Wiest, Corey Feldman and Corey Haim

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.

programme.title: Serbia: The Russia Dilemma
programme.desc: As the first anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine approaches, the majority of people in almost every European country are opposed to the war… with one notable exception. Serbia has long been an ally of Russia, with close political and economic links. It's thought more than 70% of Serbs support Moscow over Kyiv. In the capital, Belgrade, pro-Russian graffiti can be seen on walls, while souvenir shops sell President Putin merchandise and even pro-war symbols. So, where does it come from? Is it historical links between two Slavic and Orthodox nations, is it realpolitik or is something more insidious at play? BBC Newsnight's International Correspondent Joe Inwood travelled to Serbia to investigate

programme.title: Bittersweet Medicine
programme.desc: A toddler with a rare and devastating inherited condition has become the first child to be treated in the UK with a lifesaving gene therapy. The drug, called Libmeldy, is the most expensive medicine in Europe, costing nearly three million pounds ($3.48m) per patient. For the family it is bittersweet as only one of the two children can be saved. The BBC's medical editor Fergus Walsh has followed the treatment at Royal Manchester Children's Hospital over several months and has this exclusive report

She thinks that she can repair them with a little bit of effort - to spare them, she therefore asks for the power to give new life to broken and damaged objects. However, instead of 'repairing' the dolls, the half-power endows them with life... and the dolls run away.

programme.desc: Roger steps in to become a new sidekick for Stan, who is given the cold shoulder by his so-called best buddy at a bachelor party in Atlantic City. Things go swimmingly until they return home to face Francine. Meanwhile, Hayley and Steve join forces to break up a good-looking couple

programme.title: The Emily Atack Show
programme.desc: Emily takes a comedic look at wellness, with sketches seeing her getting up to mischief at the clinic and misunderstanding cheat day. Plus, impressions of Billie Eilish and Adele

programme.title: Buffering
programme.desc: Iain tries to impress his dad by pitching an idea for a ground-breaking primetime TV show to a new commissioner with the help of Finn and Rosie

programme.title: All American
programme.desc: US sports drama series inspired by the true-life story of NFL Super Bowl champion Spencer Paysinger. With playoffs and mid-term exams looming, Spencer makes a surprising discovery about his father - meanwhile, Coop desperately wants to bring down her enemies.

programme.title: Maigret

programme.title: Heartbeat

Meanwhile, Greengrass's nephew turns up with a new business partner, raising suspicions about a recent break-in. Rural drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A man begins receiving nuisance calls after a mysterious stranger moves into the village. Meanwhile, Gina's love life hots up in the kitchen - with serious repercussions. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of a trainee forensic psychologist, whose body has been dumped in a Northumberland landfill site, surroundings that make evidence of how she died impossible to verify. Vera discovers that the dead woman had been working for the prison service re-investigating a crime that a former prisoner had been convicted of, and realises she must finish what the victim started in order to discover who may have wanted her dead. Paul Kaye plays a new pathologist alongside fellow guest star Peter Davison

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A young man sat alone in the church and covered in blood confesses to Sidney and Geordie that he attacked and killed his landlord. However, when the pair investigate further, they find the alleged victim alive and well with his family. Elsewhere, Margaret's visits to the vicarage begin to leave Mrs Maguire irritated, Leonard is distracted by secretive trips to the cinema, and Geordie is compelled to deal with a surprising shoplifter. Drama set in the 1950s, starring James Norton and Robson Green

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: As the trial of local teenager Gary Bell approaches, Sidney and Geordie find themselves in disagreement regarding his guilt. Meanwhile, a man is convinced that his dead wife is haunting his home and stable yards, and implores Sidney to come to his estate and perform an exorcism for him. The vicar offers prayers and counsel, but when the man is found hanged in the exact same spot in which his wife died, Sidney and Geordie are united by a shared goal as they investigate his suicide. Drama set in the 1950s, starring James Norton and Robson Green

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ruth considers starting a new life in Australia and Simon realises the new shareholder at the paper factory is conspiring against him. Rural drama, starring Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Marsha Thomason, Jason Done and Thomas Craig

programme.desc: Trouble is brewing at The Woolpack and Louise is about to find herself public enemy number one

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Roy sticks to his guns when the police turn up, and Mike sets off on holiday, leaving Joe in charge

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Roy protests his innocence in custody, and the battles begin in the Weatherfield Skirmish

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Sent to investigate the murder of an American industrialist's wife found strangled in the kitchen of a plush hotel, Maigret initially suspects the killer may have been a member of staff - until fresh evidence makes him think again. Detective drama, starring Michael Gambon as the pipe-smoking sleuth

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: A mystery woman arranges a meeting with Maigret - and subsequently accuses him of trying to seduce her. Caught on the defensive, he suspects she's in the employ of the villain behind a series of restaurant robberies - but the truth proves far stranger. Michael Gambon stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jo makes the rash assumption that a man has taken violent steps to deal with his truanting son, and Greengrass sets up an illegal stud with a horse-training pal. Meanwhile, PC Ventress starts behaving oddly. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick investigates the theft of thousands of pounds' worth of wine from a warehouse. Meanwhile, trustworthy Greengrass becomes a gamekeeper and the truth behind Alf's strange behaviour is revealed. Rural police drama set in the rustic backwater of Aidensfield, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Mark has an unusual idea for a stag night, which involves camping under the stars rather than going to the pub. However, the jaunt ends in disaster when he becomes lost in the woods and is bitten by a snake, leaving Martin with the task of locating the clueless copper and saving his marriage before it has even begun. Meanwhile, the teenagers of Portwenn provoke the doctor's wrath by inventing a deadly game that threatens one boy's life. Martin Clunes stars

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Mark is forced to investigate his fiancee's past when a stranger arrives in the village with a mysterious photo. Mrs Tishell finally removes the neck collar she has worn for years, and suffers a prolapsed disc as a result. Martin reveals his true feelings for Louisa over a few glasses of wine, but he drinks too much and wakes the next morning to a waiting room full of giggling patients, a raging hangover and a distinct feeling of uneasiness

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: As Gary Bell waits for news about whether he will be offered a reprieve, Geordie and Phil discover a reason to arrest Eddie Jones, a violent husband who beats his wife. However, when Sidney arrives at the station the following morning, he finds Geordie with his knuckles bruised and Eddie dead on a stretcher. Chief Inspector Benson questions his innocence, and although the vicar leaps to his friend's defence, no one can verify his whereabouts when Eddie was killed. At the vicarage, a remark about Mrs Maguire's love life and the accidental loss of some sentimental postcards leave the housekeeper and Leonard feeling raw and misunderstood

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When Sidney's old friend Reverend Sam Milburn visits the parish claiming to be seeking forgiveness for his crimes, the vicar is torn. Matters complicate further when Harding Redmond finds out he has returned and makes threats against his life, and Sam flees. With his friend now missing, Sidney fears the worst and must once again join forces with Geordie to investigate. Meanwhile, Leonard continues to wrestle with his feelings for Daniel Marlowe, and a visit from Mrs Maguire leads to Amanda having a heart-to-heart with Guy

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The situation at the factory takes its toll on Simon, whose health and relationship with Ruth begin to suffer. Cheryl and Dick get the results of their fertility test, and Vic is forced to eat his words when the Skelthwaite Scorpions are hammered by a visiting team. Rural drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ruth considers starting a new life in Australia and Simon realises the new shareholder at the paper factory is conspiring against him. Rural drama, starring Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Marsha Thomason, Jason Done and Thomas Craig

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Olive becomes convinced Arthur is having an affair with a conductress at the depot. Comedy, with Reg Varney, Anna Karen and Michael Robbins

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack decide to get fit, disturbed to learn that bus crews have a short life expectancy. Comedy, with Reg Varney

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The sleuth is visited by Ernestine, the wife of a burglar known as 'Sad Freddie'. While breaking into a house he discovered a body and is so alarmed he has fled the country. The trail leads Maigret to a dentist who lives with his domineering elderly mother. Drama, starring Michael Gambon

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a victim of fraud is found murdered on a golf course - but his inquiries are complicated by the discovery of a tramp's mutilated body nearby. To make matters worse, beautiful singer Bella Duveen is also around, seemingly intent on helping herself to a grim souvenir. David Suchet stars, with Hugh Fraser, Bill Moody and Jacinta Mulcahy

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth heads to Lake Windermere for a holiday with faithful assistant Hastings, only to find his crime-solving skills are once again needed to investigate a murder. The only witness to the crime is a dog, leaving Poirot with a difficult task to find the killer. David Suchet stars, with Kate Buffery, Patrick Ryecart and Julia St John

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth has retired to a charming English village in the hope of finding peace and quiet. However, the murder of a rich industrialist neighbour forces him to leave his new lifestyle behind as he plunges into a sordid world of blackmail and envy, aided by the dogged Chief Inspector Japp. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, Philip Jackson, Malcolm Terris and Oliver Ford Davies

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A professor is found dead on Halloween with a stake through her heart and Hobson reveals she shared a house with the victim in her university days. A medium visits Lewis claiming to have foreseen the tragedy, and ghostly messages spelled out in fridge magnet letters start appearing in a house occupied by four students. As the detective struggles with the possibility his friend is somehow implicated in the crime, a tale of jealousy and revenge begins to unfold. Rupert Graves (Sherlock) and Niamh Cusack (Heartbeat) guest star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Troy is playing in an annual cricket match between Midsomer Worthy and Fletchers Cross when tragedy strikes. The wife of one of the team captains, a wealthy local landowner, is found battered to death with a cricket bat in a quarry. As Barnaby and Troy investigate, they discover no end of people with a grudge against the victim's husband - who may have been complicit in some other suspicious deaths. Guest starring Imelda Staunton and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A fox-hunt turns sour when a tramp is found dead in the woods, and matters are further complicated by the murder of the chief suspect's father. As DCI Barnaby investigates, he concludes it is only a matter of time before another member of the tight-knit community suffers the same fate. Guest starring James Bolam

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A cleaner is found dead in her home and suspicion immediately falls upon her lodger, who is arrested and convicted of her murder. It appears to be an open-and-shut case, but Superintendent Spence begins to question the man's guilt and invites Poirot to help uncover the identity of the real killer. The Belgian sleuth teams up with crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) as he tries to crack the case. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Richard Hope, Joe Absolom, Amanda Root, Sian Phillips and Raquel Cassidy

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Jack and Stan volunteer Olive as supervisor for the depot nursery. However, when she breaks her glasses and has to go home for a spare pair the clueless duo are left holding the fort. Comedy, starring Reg Varney, Bob Grant and Anna Karen

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan believes living at home is cramping his style and resolves to find his own place. Vintage comedy with Reg Varney and Bob Grant

Meanwhile, Leonard continues to wrestle with his feelings for Daniel Marlowe, and a visit from Mrs Maguire leads to Amanda having a heart-to-heart with Guy

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The situation at the factory takes its toll on Simon, whose health and relationship with Ruth begin to suffer. Cheryl and Dick get the results of their fertility test, and Vic is forced to eat his words when the Skelthwaite Scorpions are hammered by a visiting team. Rural drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ruth considers starting a new life in Australia and Simon realises the new shareholder at the paper factory is conspiring against him. Stephen makes careful plans to get pregnant Jacqui to the hospital _ which are wrecked when she goes into labour just as Skelthwaite is hit by a power cut. Rural drama, starring Sarah Lancashire, Pam Ferris, Marsha Thomason, Jason Done and Thomas Craig

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Olive becomes convinced Arthur is having an affair with a conductress at the depot. Comedy, with Reg Varney, Anna Karen and Michael Robbins

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack decide to get fit, disturbed to learn that bus crews have a short life expectancy. Comedy, with Reg Varney

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The sleuth is visited by Ernestine, the wife of a burglar known as 'Sad Freddie'. While breaking into a house he discovered a body and is so alarmed he has fled the country. The trail leads Maigret to a dentist who lives with his domineering elderly mother. Drama, starring Michael Gambon

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a victim of fraud is found murdered on a golf course - but his inquiries are complicated by the discovery of a tramp's mutilated body nearby. To make matters worse, beautiful singer Bella Duveen is also around, seemingly intent on helping herself to a grim souvenir. David Suchet stars, with Hugh Fraser, Bill Moody and Jacinta Mulcahy

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth heads to Lake Windermere for a holiday with faithful assistant Hastings, only to find his crime-solving skills are once again needed to investigate a murder. The only witness to the crime is a dog, leaving Poirot with a difficult task to find the killer. David Suchet stars, with Kate Buffery, Patrick Ryecart and Julia St John

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth has retired to a charming English village in the hope of finding peace and quiet. However, the murder of a rich industrialist neighbour forces him to leave his new lifestyle behind as he plunges into a sordid world of blackmail and envy, aided by the dogged Chief Inspector Japp. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, Philip Jackson, Malcolm Terris and Oliver Ford Davies

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A professor is found dead on Halloween with a stake through her heart and Hobson reveals she shared a house with the victim in her university days. A medium visits Lewis claiming to have foreseen the tragedy, and ghostly messages spelled out in fridge magnet letters start appearing in a house occupied by four students. As the detective struggles with the possibility his friend is somehow implicated in the crime, a tale of jealousy and revenge begins to unfold. Rupert Graves (Sherlock) and Niamh Cusack (Heartbeat) guest star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Troy is playing in an annual cricket match between Midsomer Worthy and Fletchers Cross when tragedy strikes. The wife of one of the team captains, a wealthy local landowner, is found battered to death with a cricket bat in a quarry. As Barnaby and Troy investigate, they discover no end of people with a grudge against the victim's husband - who may have been complicit in some other suspicious deaths. Guest starring Imelda Staunton and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A fox-hunt turns sour when a tramp is found dead in the woods, and matters are further complicated by the murder of the chief suspect's father. As DCI Barnaby investigates, he concludes it is only a matter of time before another member of the tight-knit community suffers the same fate. Guest starring James Bolam

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A cleaner is found dead in her home and suspicion immediately falls upon her lodger, who is arrested and convicted of her murder. It appears to be an open-and-shut case, but Superintendent Spence begins to question the man's guilt and invites Poirot to help uncover the identity of the real killer. The Belgian sleuth teams up with crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) as he tries to crack the case. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Richard Hope, Joe Absolom, Amanda Root, Sian Phillips and Raquel Cassidy

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Jack and Stan volunteer Olive as supervisor for the depot nursery. However, when she breaks her glasses and has to go home for a spare pair the clueless duo are left holding the fort. Comedy, starring Reg Varney, Bob Grant and Anna Karen

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan believes living at home is cramping his style and resolves to find his own place. Vintage comedy with Reg Varney and Bob Grant
