programme.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Mycroft Holmes joins his brother to investigate the murder of a professor's secretary. The only clue is a golden pince-nez found clenched in the hand of the victim. Charles Gray guest stars

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: An unpopular practical joker caps his career by leaving Magnum more than $50million in his will _ but the bequest makes him a target for murder. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: Two villains rob an art dealer of a valuable Goya painting, which they plan to sell in Amsterdam. Regan deduces the dealer's female assistant is an accomplice, and after leaning on her sets off to track down the duo. Seventies crime drama, starring John Thaw

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: When Dave's relief manager lets him down at short notice, he asks Terry to step into the breach and run the Winchester Club for him. However, concerns mount for both Terry and Arthur when the landlord fails to return as planned - especially as the club's licence is due for imminent renewal. George Cole and Dennis Waterman star

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Templar has to find out whether a cool blonde is a secret agent or a crook - and if she could do him harm. Sixties spy adventure, directed by and starring Roger Moore

programme.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A reclusive lodger's strange behaviour sends his landlady running to Holmes for advice - and what initially seems to be a simple matter turns into a mystery involving an Italian secret society and murder in New York. Drama, starring Jeremy Brett

programme.title: The Motorbike Show
programme.desc: Henry Cole is in Somerset riding a Honda Goldwing. He meets historians and cheesemakers along the way, and also drops in on the Haynes motor museum. Back on the Kawasaki restoration, Allen fabricates and fits an exceptional exhaust system

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade returns to Africa's Okavango Delta to reinvestigate the tigerfish - a pack-hunting carnivore previously blamed for mauling the victims of a capsized boat. If these fish are as lethal as Jeremy concluded, then why aren't there more reports of fatal, piranha-like attacks? In a bid to flush out the true nature of these sight-hunting predators, Jeremy puts on his dive gear and offers himself as live bait

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur becomes involved with a gambler, whose sudden death leaves the dodgy car dealer £2,000 worse off. Meanwhile, Terry helps his old flame Sylvie leave her abusive husband. Billy Connolly guest stars in the vintage comedy drama, alongside George Cole and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: World of Sport
programme.desc: Richard Henwood takes a look back at The Indoor League. A show featuring 1970s pub games, presented by Yorkshire cricketing great Fred Trueman.

programme.title: Arnold Clark Cup Live
programme.desc: Italy Women v Belgium Women (Kick-off 4.45pm). Laura Woods presents coverage of the opening match of the round-robin tournament, held at Stadium MK. With analysis by Anita Asante and commentary from Seb Hutchinson and Eni Aluko

programme.title: Arnold Clark Cup Live
programme.desc: England Women v Korea Republic Women (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from both teams' opening match of the round-robin tournament, held at Stadium MK. England are the holders of this trophy and will hope to get off to a winning start ahead of matches against Belgium and Italy. However, the Koreans, who are managed by Englishman Colin Bell, are the reigning Asian champions and are likely to provide a stern test for Sarina Wiegman's side. With analysis from Ian Wright and Karen Carney, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Emma Hayes

programme.title: Game of Death (2011)

Action thriller, starring Wesley Snipes and Zoe Bell

programme.title: The Motorbike Show
programme.desc: Henry Cole brings his latest restoration to a stunning conclusion, road-tests a brand-new British electric bike, and tells the story of the Kawasaki Z1

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Thomas gallantly steps in to help a basketball star who is being used as a pawn by her manipulative parents - and manages to do an ailing team a considerable favour in the process. Tom Selleck stars

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: An armed gang kidnaps a telephone engineer and uses his expertise to remotely trigger break-in alarms in various banks. While police are diverted to the affected premises, the crooks target other banks. Regan is offended when a telecommunications expert from Bristol CID is drafted in to assist him and Carter with the investigation. Police drama, starring John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: A tape implicating two senior police officers in a criminal conspiracy is mistakenly delivered to Daley Videos, and Arthur and Terry find themselves placed in contact with its owner - a local major crime boss. Ian McShane, Rula Lenska, Brian Blessed and Ray Winstone guest star

programme.title: The Motorbike Show
programme.desc: Henry Cole brings his latest restoration to a stunning conclusion, road-tests a brand-new British electric bike, and tells the story of the Kawasaki Z1

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh host with the quiz, as Scott Mills, Gareth Malone, Louise Minchin and Glenn Hoddle pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Junk and Disorderly
programme.desc: Henry Cole visits automobilia heaven, Allen and Skid fix a monkey bike, and the three Junketeers head to Stratford in a bid to sell their restored items

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Jon Moxley, Chris Jericho, Bryan Danielson and Claudio Castagnoli, and many more who bring a freshness and energy into professional wrestling.

programme.title: Lucy (2014)
programme.desc: A courier is kidnapped and forced to become a drug mule. When she is exposed to the experimental chemicals she is smuggling, it boosts her intelligence and reflexes to superhuman levels. She uses her newfound abilities to get revenge on her captors, but as the process continues, she evolves into something more than human. Sci-fi thriller, starring Scarlett Johansson and Morgan Freeman

Howard Hawks' Western, starring John Wayne, Montgomery Clift, Walter Brennan, Joanne Dru and Coleen Gray

programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service (1969)
programme.desc: While on leave, James Bond prevents a young woman - Teresa 'Tracy' Draco - from committing suicide. Her father is Marc-Ange Draco, the head of a powerful crime syndicate who is impressed by Bond and wants him to protect his daughter by marrying her. In exchange, he offers Bond information that will lead him to master criminal and arch-enemy Ernst Stavro Blofeld, who is intent on destroying world peace by means of a lethal virus unless he receives an international amnesty for his crimes. Spy adventure, starring George Lazenby in his only outing as 007, alongside Telly Savalas, Diana Rigg, Gabriele Ferzetti and Bernard Lee

programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service (1969)
programme.desc: While on leave, James Bond prevents a young woman - Teresa 'Tracy' Draco - from committing suicide. Her father is Marc-Ange Draco, the head of a powerful crime syndicate who is impressed by Bond and wants him to protect his daughter by marrying her. In exchange, he offers Bond information that will lead him to master criminal and arch-enemy Ernst Stavro Blofeld, who is intent on destroying world peace by means of a lethal virus unless he receives an international amnesty for his crimes. After recently turning 30, she decides that it's time to finally leave the family home and move into a place of her own - she enlists the help of her friends to declutter and realises that she is holding on to more than just material things, but how will her dad take the news of her moving out, and where will Saff move to? Diags is struggling to adjust to his life as manager at Plumb Point - luckily, Dan and Gatsby are on hand with support, and suggest he practices his interview and management skills. As patron of the pressure group Dignity in Dying, Prue is campaigning for British law to be changed. However, Conservative MP Danny, Chair of Dying Well, is keen to prevent any change to existing circumstances. She never returned, having apparently vanished into thin air. Presenter Emilia Fox, leading criminologist Professor David Wilson and former senior detective Dr Graham Hill investigate the circumstances surrounding Trevaline's disappearance and identify several new suspects

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

A two-year-old has a seizure, and a 23-month-old has a large lump on their head as a result of a fall.

Owner John Esposito left school at the age of 14 and has worked at his parents' restaurant, Sal's Pizzeria, ever since. Rovers missed out on the play-offs last season after finishing eighth in the table, while Wigan came second in the regular season standings, but were defeated by Leeds Rhinos in the semi-finals. With Sam Tomkins, Kyle Amor, Danika Priim and Mark Wilson

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Dartmoor couple Maria and Andy met on Cyprus 20 years ago, got married there and now plan to live there permanently. They're particularly fond of Famagusta, and want a home that will work for them and their much-loved cat Keo. With their budget of £140,000, property expert Jean Johansson lines up five stunning homes for them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton meets Andi and Neil from York, who dream of retiring permanently to Spain with their son Joel and spaniel Dixie. They're looking for a three-bedroom house with a dog-friendly garden, where barbeque enthusiast Neil can cook up a storm close to the beach close to the coastal town of Mazarrón, near Murcia. Laura has five sizzling options for their budget of £145,000, but will any of them turn out to be their new forever home?

programme.title: Chateau DIY

A soap-maker, who uses milk from her own cow, hopes to win new business with her latest dog shampoo products, while a muesli maker prepares a bid for a place at the hotel buffet table

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes tales of Osborne House on the Isle of Wight, which was bought by Queen Victoria and Prince Albert in 1840 and was turned into their perfect renaissance hideaway. Kate Williams goes on a culinary adventure and tries traditional Tudor cuisine, including snails and pigs' feet, while the horrors of the palaces' bedding ceremony is revealed, where a royal bride is observed on her wedding night to make sure the marriage is consummated

programme.title: Carry On: Secrets & Scandals
programme.desc: Made on the tiniest of budgets, the films in the Carry On franchise made millions at the box office, and are still regularly repeated on TV. This programme reveals the truth behind the films' cheeky, cheerful image, with behind-the-scenes stories about how they were made, including shocking secrets from the series' stars. The documentary broadcasts, for the first time, interviews recorded by cast members at an event in 1998, where they reveal their true feelings about their treatment at the hands of producer Peter Rogers

programme.title: When Classic Films Go Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Big screen slip-ups from the likes of Tom Cruise, Bruce Willis and Tippi Hedren. Mark Ruffalo puts his foot in it when he reveals the plot of Avengers: Infinity War. Fans are left baffled by Hollywood blockbuster Cats, and poor CGI befalls Justice League, with Henry Cavill's moustache getting attention for all the wrong reasons. Plus, Robert Downey Jr's Welsh accent in Dolittle leaves fans scratching their heads, and there's an uproar at the release of Monty Python's Life of Brian. Contributors include John Thomson, Patsy Kensit, comedian Rufus Hound and veteran actors Madeline Smith, Valerie Leon and Derren Nesbitt

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Around the World by Train with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The actor heads to Japan, taking the bullet train to Kyoto and meeting young people there who are rebelling against the traditional corporate lifestyle expectations of Japanese society. Tony then travels through the world's longest - and deepest - undersea rail tunnel, emerging in the thick snow of Hakodate.

programme.title: Get Your Tatts Out: Kavos Ink
programme.desc: Everyday life in a tattoo parlour catering to British tourists on Greece's Kavos strip. Georgia has fallen for her holiday company representative, so she decides to get his name permanently inked on her bottom. Fun-loving Madison asks for a bizarre design that mixes balloons with half a chicken, and Connor opts for a picture of a melon on his backside

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: The life and work of Pieter Bruegel the Elder, generally considered the greatest Flemish painter of the 16th century, whose works remain among the most distinctive examples of Renaissance art, combining gritty humour with political comment. Tim Marlow reveals how Bruegel was influenced by the period of immense social change in which he lived

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton joins interior designer Ann Maurice as she applies her expertise to the task of revamping a three-storey stone cottage in Chippenham, Wiltshire, hoping to increase its sales potential

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit has all kinds of boats for hire down at the lake, and Daddy Pig picks one with pedals. However, when the families race, he wishes he had chosen an easier one to sail

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Sweetie steals the princess's crown and frames Chase for the crime

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: The duo team up against Jamila and Zac in Frankie's quiz game. However, when the final score is declared, Pip and Posy handle the result very differently

programme.title: Ministry of Fear (1944)
programme.desc: An innocent man recently released from a mental hospital inadvertently takes possession of a piece of microfilm meant for a Nazi agent, and finds himself on the run from both the police and the Nazis. Fritz Lang's spy thriller, based on Graham Greene's novel, starring Ray Milland, Marjorie Reynolds, Carl Esmond and Hillary Brooke

programme.title: The Wrong Box (1966)
programme.desc: Two elderly brothers each stand to inherit a fortune if the other dies first - but one of them is not prepared to leave anything to chance, and begins a series of disastrous attempts on his unsuspecting sibling's life. However, when one of the pair appears to have really died, his nephews conspire to cover it up. Black comedy, with John Mills, Ralph Richardson, Michael Caine, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore

programme.title: Father Brown (1954)
programme.desc: When works of art start disappearing, stolen by a master thief, Father Brown attempts to catch the culprit and save his soul. Comedy drama, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood and Peter Finch

programme.title: Gunfight at the OK Corral (1957)
programme.desc: US Marshal Wyatt Earp lays down his badge to live a peaceful life with his brothers in the town of Tombstone. As a feud erupts with the ruthless Clanton gang, he forms an unlikely alliance with hard-drinking gambler Doc Holliday to face them in a historic showdown. Western, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas, Dennis Hopper, Lee Van Cleef and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee (1986)
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum

programme.title: The Girl in the Spider's Web (2018)
programme.desc: Swedish hacker Lisbeth Salander is hired by computer genius Frans Balder to retrieve Firefall, a programme capable of accessing the world's nuclear codes that he developed for the National Security Agency. Though Salander manages to find Firefall, it's not long before she's fighting for her life against mercenaries. Thriller, starring Claire Foy and Sylvia Hoeks

programme.title: No Way Out (1987)
programme.desc: A navy officer unwittingly has an affair with a politician's mistress, and becomes involved in the investigation after she is murdered. However, he soon suspects the plan is to find a scapegoat rather than the real killer - and that he is the most likely candidate to take the fall. Political thriller, starring Kevin Costner, Gene Hackman, Sean Young, Iman and George Dzundza

programme.title: Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit (2014)
programme.desc: A former soldier injured in the line of duty takes up a new career as a financial analyst for the CIA. However, his deskbound position changes to a dangerous undercover assignment when he discovers a plot to destroy the US economy. Spy thriller inspired by Tom Clancy's novels, starring Chris Pine, Keira Knightley, Kevin Costner and Kenneth Branagh, who also directed

programme.title: The Long Arm (1956)
programme.desc: A dedicated Scotland Yard police superintendent battles to overcome stress both at home and work, while putting his instincts and scientific knowledge to the task of catching a notorious safecracker. However, the case takes a shocking turn when the elusive criminal commits murder. Crime thriller, starring Jack Hawkins, Dorothy Alison, Geoffrey Keen and Newton Blick

programme.title: The Bedford Incident (1965)
programme.desc: The ruthless captain of a US destroyer develops an obsession with tracking down a Russian submarine. As he drives his men harder, he fails to anticipate the consequences of his actions - leading to a fatal mistake. Cold War thriller, starring Richard Widmark, Sidney Poitier, Martin Balsam, Wally Cox, Eric Portman and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: Tobruk (1967)
programme.desc: Jewish resistance fighters out to destroy Nazi fuel bunkers during the North African campaign recruit a Canadian major experienced in desert warfare. Risking life and limb, they pose as a German transport detail escorting British prisoners, but it becomes clear that someone in their group is a traitor. Second World War adventure, starring George Peppard, Rock Hudson, Nigel Green and Guy Stockwell

programme.title: The Muppets Take Manhattan (1984)
programme.desc: Kermit, Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and company try to take Broadway by storm with their college show, setting the stage for a host of misadventures as they yearn for stardom in the Big Apple and set out to raise the money to finance their production. Comedy, performed by Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with appearances by Liza Minnelli, Art Carney, Dabney Coleman, Gregory Hines, Joan Rivers, Brooke Shields, Linda Lavin and Elliott Gould

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey (1991)
programme.desc: The would-be heavy metal superstars face the Grim Reaper as they try to reclaim their souls from Hell, return to the land of the living and stop their robot doppelgangers from changing history. Along the way, they must also master their instruments, so they can triumph at the Battle of the Bands. Comedy sequel, starring Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter, William Sadler, Joss Ackland and George Carlin

programme.title: AI: Artificial Intelligence (2001)
programme.desc: A highly advanced robotic boy is created with one purpose - to love his owner as a parent. When he is rejected by his 'mother', he is left to roam the bleak landscapes of a futuristic America with a fellow android, searching for a means of becoming a real boy in the hope of regaining her love. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi drama, starring Haley Joel Osment, Jude Law, William Hurt and Frances O'Connor

programme.title: Watchmen (2009)
programme.desc: At the height of the Cold War, former superheroes driven into retirement by public outcry are confronted with the murder of one of their number. As they face the possibility of a conspiracy to eliminate them, they must contend with a world edging closer to the brink of nuclear war. Sci-fi drama, based on Alan Moore and Dave Gibbons' graphic novel, starring Patrick Wilson, Jackie Earle Haley, Malin Akerman and Billy Crudup

programme.title: Monster House (2006)
programme.desc: A boy becomes obsessed with a sinister elderly neighbour living in a creepy old house. On Halloween night, he and two friends discover the chilling truth - the house is alive and eats anything that comes too close, including children. Animated comedy horror, with the voices of Mitchel Musso, Sam Lerner, Spencer Locke, Steve Buscemi, Maggie Gyllenhaal and Jason Lee

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (2010)
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes

programme.title: Addams Family Values (1993)
programme.desc: Spooky couple Gomez and Morticia hire a nanny to look after their new baby son - and stop him suffering an early death at the hands of his jealous elder siblings. Romance soon blossoms between the new childminder and Uncle Fester, but he does not realise she is planning to kill him once she has got hold of the family fortune. Comedy sequel, starring Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci and Joan Cusack

programme.title: The Italian Job (1969)
programme.desc: A crook assembles a motley gang to steal £4million in gold bullion from an Italian armoured car, which brings Turin to a standstill and enables the robbers to make a quick getaway in a fleet of Minis - but they end up falling foul of the Mafia along the way. Crime comedy, starring Michael Caine, Noel Coward, Benny Hill, Tony Beckley and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Fantastic Four (2015)
programme.desc: A gifted young scientist joins members of a secret project researching inter-dimensional travel, and they return from a journey to another world with superhuman powers. Their abilities make them the only hope for Earth's survival when a colleague who was lost on their expedition returns to wreak vengeance. Superhero adventure, starring Miles Teller, Michael B Jordan, Kate Mara and Jamie Bell

programme.title: Passengers (2016)
programme.desc: A spacecraft transporting thousands of people to a distant planet malfunctions. As woken travelling companions Jim Preston and Aurora Lane fall in love, they are soon on a collision course with more technical problems and a dark secret. Sci-fi drama, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Pratt and Michael Sheen

programme.title: No One Lives (2012)
programme.desc: A gang of criminals kidnaps a couple and holds them hostage at an abandoned house in the middle of nowhere. As the crooks' plans start to unravel and they end up killing one of their captives, they come under attack from a mysterious psychopath who intends to make sure no one gets out of the building alive. Horror, starring Luke Evans and Adelaide Clemens

programme.title: Brawl in Cell Block 99 (2017)
programme.desc: A former boxer is blackmailed into performing a prison hit by a ruthless drug kingpin. Crime thriller, starring Vince Vaughn, Jennifer Carpenter and Don Johnson

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: It's Valentine's Day in the village, and Juliet decides to plan a romantic gesture for Peri, while James makes an unexpected announcement

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: John Paul tries to hide his drinking relapse from his family, Tony takes Darren up on his offer to help at The Dog, and Honour gets a shock call from the prison

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits family-run Luigi's in Orange County, California, where lazy shortcuts following the retirement of the owner's father have led the business to suffer. Ramsay faces the daunting task of reuniting a feuding family, before turning around the struggling restaurant, which currently has 126 dishes on the menu

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay heads to the Park's Edge restaurant in Atlanta, Georgia, where a series of spats with the local community are hampering its success. Owners Richard and Jorge's in-fighting has alienated locals, and the duo's suggestion that customer numbers are low because of racism has heightened tensions

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly intervenes when she finds out that Coach Mellor has a strained relationship with his brother, Coach Nick, but when the two men face off in the gym, Adam and Barry join in. Meanwhile, Geoff and Erica struggle with their long-distance relationship

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly decides to reinvent herself by going to night school so that she can quit her substitute teacher role and own her own business, but Murray dislikes change and tries to convince her to take a different path. Meanwhile, Barry embarks on a makeover of his own, and Erica struggles to balance her academic studies with her social life in college and calls on Adam for assistance

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang's preparations for Star Wars Day are interrupted by the news that Professor Proton has died. Leonard and Penny attend the funeral, where they talk about their rejected marriage proposals, but Sheldon has difficulty dealing with the death of his childhood hero - until a surprise visitor helps him cope with his grief. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco, with a guest appearance by Bob Newhart

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets fired from the movie, prompting her to take a serious look at her life. Raj receives advice from Sheldon after he sees Emily on a date with another man at the cinema, while Howard's mother breaks her leg. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay hopes for a quiet afternoon on the lake fishing, but his family has other plans involving fuss and thrills. Claire and Mitchell become trapped in their childhood home, Phil meets his arch-enemy from college at a shopping centre and Cam encounters a sticky situation at the bakery. Meanwhile, the children face the task of creatively editing their grandfather's birthday video

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The calamity-prone group visits a guest ranch where Mitch and Cam hope to rediscover their macho side, and a cowboy named Hank takes an instant shine to Gloria. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Desperate circumstances call for desperate measures as Peralta, Captain Holt, Santiago, Jeffords, Diaz and Boyle are forced to ally themselves with some old enemies

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake leads a manhunt after an assassination attempt on a city councillor, while Holt adjusts to his new position as a uniformed officer

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard runs against Sheldon to be president of the tenants' association, while Bernadette encourages Howard and Raj to track down the owner of a drone they find in the back garden

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: A brilliant but reclusive scientist, Dr Wolcott, invites Sheldon to his cabin in the middle of nowhere, so Leonard, Raj and Howard go along for the trip. Penny and Bernadette improvise when Amy doesn't like the tame bachelorette party they have planned for her. Peter MacNicol guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang re-creates a prom night on the roof of the apartment building when the girls decide they would like to re-enact their evenings with their current partners. However, Sheldon feels under pressure to take part in all the romantic traditions, and Howard worries about who Stuart will bring as his date. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon panics when Leonard announces he has to go into hospital for surgery, and the impending divorce of Raj's parents motivates Howard and Bernadette to work on their own marriage. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil fears the worst when he misses a call informing him of the results of a routine medical, while Manny's day out with Jay is going well until he is whisked away for a belated birthday treat at the horse races. American comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Ed O'Neill

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Claire help Manny and Luke with a school project - building capsules that would best protect an egg in a two-storey drop. Meanwhile, Phil enlists the help of Haley and Gloria as he prepares for a major real-estate presentation, while Mitch and Cameron use the power of song to impress prospective birth mothers. American comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Ed O'Neill

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The squad members partner up for their next Halloween Heist - unaware they have to be handcuffed to each other. But that is just the start of their problems

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: During a family intervention, Sally makes siblings John Paul and Mercedes realise they need each other. Diane decides to distant herself from Beau

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Naked Attraction

Next up is 30-year-old waitress Kerry from Aberdeen, who finds the smell of men's armpits gets her hot under the collar and wants a man with a sweet scent who can also get experimental in the bedroom

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: An aspiring Paralympian goes on a date with a former footballer, while a double divorcee hopes to make it third time lucky, if her long list of very specific requirements do not hold her back. A car salesman ponders how to raise the subject of BDSM on his first date with a primary school teacher, and a previous visitor to the bar returns for a second try

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Reviewed shows include The Button, The Queen's Birthday Party, Britain's Got Talent, University Challenge, This Morning, The Real Camilla: HRH The Duchess of Cornwall, and Top of the Shop. First aired in April 2018

Ramsay faces the daunting task of reuniting a feuding family, before turning around the struggling restaurant, which currently has 126 dishes on the menu

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: The Goldbergs

Gordon sets out to get to the bottom of Makis's reluctance to teach his son, and uncovers a shocking family secret

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon becomes upset about his career, the destruction of the comic-book store and Leonard and Penny's future living arrangements. Elsewhere, Howard is unable to keep hold of a carer for his mother. Comedy, staring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Meanwhile, Jay blames Stella the dog's recent behaviour on Gloria. American comedy, starring Aubrey Anderson-Emmons and Julie Bowen

Meanwhile, problems arise when Jay and Gloria open up their doors to Mitch and Cameron, whose house is being fumigated. American comedy, guest starring Greg Kinnear

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The entire squad is on high alert when a massive blackout hits Brooklyn. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg as a detective with a light-hearted approach to crime

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Comedy, guest starring James Earl Jones and Carrie Fisher

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Below Deck: Mediterranean

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: A round-up of memorable moments featured on the show over the course of 2022. programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson welcomes 24-year-old Sian from Norfolk, a petrol head who wants to find a man she can love more than her beloved car, and 33-year-old fashion entrepreneur Tansel from London. He is looking to settle down and hopes that losing ignoring the clothes for once will help him find the right girl

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose a date from six naked people whose bare bodies are revealed from the feet up. First up is 27-year-old sex-toy tester Hayley from Plymouth. Hayley has cerebral palsy and has only ever dated friends. Can she find someone to be more than just good friends? She is followed by 25-year-old tree surgeon Dmitri from Nottingham, who is looking for the perfect partner. However, once he picks his date, Dmitri is in for a big shock

programme.title: First Dates

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

The challenge of turning around the hotel's fortunes only increases when the chef sees shocking allegations about Phillip splashed all over the front page of the local newspaper

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: In Oregon, Gordon Ramsay tries to rescue the Applegate River Lodge, which is around $1million in debt. The chef questions whether owner Richard Davis's interest in smoking cannabis is distracting him from the problems at this family-built inn, and encounters Richard's sons Duke and Dusty, whose fiery relationship seems to prevent them from working together to tackle the establishment's financial troubles

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a dog-friendly hotel in West Dover, Vermont, that is in urgent need of help. Owner Sandy MacDougall runs the Four Seasons Inn like a hostel, with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests. The acerbic chef aims to get the business back on track before Sandy loses everything, but wonders whether it would be kinder to simply put this dog-friendly hotel to sleep

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell manipulates Jay to make him think that an old friend might be gay when he notices several questionable signs. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire is made to feel inadequate when an old friend visits, while Jay has a worrying locker room encounter. Guest starring Minnie Driver (Good Will Hunting)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The families prepare to woo their significant others on Valentine's Day. Claire plans a special, romantic getaway with Phil, and Jay decides to treat Gloria to a stand-up show. Meanwhile, Cam and Mitchell play Cupid for Manny to end his quest for a date

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Luke spend father-son time together searching for hidden treasures beneath the house, Mitch and Cam cause embarrassment by inviting Lily's paediatrician to lunch, and Haley takes her driving test

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon upsets guest star Stephen Hawking when they play an online game of Words with Friends, until Howard advises him to let the scientist win. Elsewhere, Penny enrols in a college class, but decides to keep it a secret from Leonard. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Amy and Wil Wheaton get into a fight while filming Fun with Flags, Sheldon suffers the consequences of their fall-out. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends try to solve the mystery of Sheldon's post-lunch activities, following him to a secret room where they discover how he chills out. Elsewhere, Leonard is jealous when Penny starts texting a classmate, but things quickly change when Alex gets flirty with him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon feels undermined when his parking space at the university is allocated to Howard instead, and his determination to cling on to the spot causes a rift in the pair's friendship. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As part of the relationship agreement, Sheldon reluctantly has to take care of Amy when she gets sick, but she loves the extra attention so much she pretends to remain in poor health. Elsewhere, Howard tries to get some tips on manliness from Penny when he and Bernadette go to visit her father

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny makes an important decision after Leonard tries to help her in the aftermath of a failed role on a TV show. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to relax after he is forced to take a holiday, and when Penny quits her job the duo end up spending time together. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the guys are unable to get tickets for Comic-Con, Leonard, Howard and Raj decide to buy fake passes from a stranger - but they then worry about getting caught with them. programme.title: Evolution (2001)

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The home of a retired lift attendant from Leeds goes under the hammer at auction and the team are hoping for a good profit to pass on to any heirs they can find. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: No-nonsense bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn arefirst to host at Llwyn Onn Guest House in Betws-y-Coed, north Wales. Former airline cabin crew assistant Nicola Ellershaw makes a less than sparkly discovery when she checks in. Wayne and Tracy challenge their guests to design biker leathers for their own gang, before Jon and Chelli Bean make a shock revelation about Jon's past. At breakfast, Gary Pesticcio challenges his hosts, which his competitors label as game playing, and at feedback time Wayne and Tracy have to face some home truths

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second hosts of the week are newlywed hoteliers Jon and Chelli Bean from the Parkwood Hotel in Stockton-on-Tees

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third hosts of the week are Nicola Ellershaw and Mackenzie Griffey, who hope to impress with the stylish fare on offer at The Pug and Greyhound in Leicestershire

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests' final stay is at The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where Gary Pesticcio and his daughter Naomi hope their hi-tech approach to hospitality will impress

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid, and the atmosphere turns sour when Jon and Chelli Bean disagree with Gary and Naomi Pesticcio's thoughts on their facility. Plus, Nicola Ellershaw and Mackenzie Griffey of The Pug and Greyhound in Great Glen want to unlock the reasons why their rooms were described as being 'like prison cells'

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Before winter arrives, Dick Strawbridge and Angel Adoree take on their next project, transforming a 35-foot long, eight-ton river boat into luxury guest accommodation. While Angel completely overhauls the old nautical interior with bespoke fabrics and unique crafts, Dick has the small task of installing the boat's very own wind turbine and a decking that reaches over the moat

programme.title: Grand Designs: Living in
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud presents one of four special programmes inspired by 15 years of Grand Designs. He begins with a look at the challenges of self-building in the city, where space is at a premium and architects have to be at their most ingenious. Kevin uses footage from the best urban builds from the show over the years, meets pioneers at the forefront of the latest architectural thinking and looks at clever innovations that continue to transform people's lives to reveal which designs work best and why

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The team treats 78-year-old Kevin, who suffered a cardiac arrest at the gym and fortunately received life-saving treatment at the scene from an instructor trained to use a portable defibrillator. programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: Domestic burglaries in Wiltshire have risen by more than 20 per cent in the past year and this edition explores what lies behind this troubling statistic, looking at the police's struggle to support victims and try to catch the culprits. In Swindon, a burglar is caught red-handed stealing food from someone's freezer, while a 999 call is received from a terrified single woman who has been woken by the sound of breaking glass to find to her horror that her home is being ransacked while she is in her bed

programme.title: Shocking Emergency Calls
programme.desc: A family trip to the Cincinnati Zoo turns into chaos and horror as a three-year-old falls into the enclosure of Harambe, the silverback gorilla. A bride's wedding day should be the happiest day of her life, but not for Kelly Ecker. Through frantic emergency calls the domestic abuse she suffers at the hands of her groom is exposed, resulting in a shocking murder-suicide

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary follows the work of the stroke team at south London's King's College Hospital. programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.desc: The competition starts at The Shoes in Durham, where landlord Billy Gowland and partner Debbie Nelson hope their footwear-themed pub and B&B is the right fit for their visitors. programme.title: Four in a Bed

With a red carpet and over 6,000 hand-glued diamante studs on the walls, some of the guests compare the decor to Dubai. They get a taste of life in the fast lane when James lets them take the hotel's fleet of premium hire cars out for a spin. And later, during a remote control car race, there's some unexpected behaviour from one guest. Fiona and James are expecting good feedback, but have to confront the fact that their guests wouldn't all be keen to return

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Having moved in with Katy's mum to save for a deposit, they had not only grown used to home comforts, but also the vibrant village atmosphere of pricey Fiveways - an area where their property dreams didn't match their budget. With Phil's help they widened the net, viewing four fantastic finds in and around Brighton. Two years later, Phil's back to see whether life on the coast has been plain sailing. And in 2019, Kirstie was scouring east London with 'granny on the go' Janet. Aware her cooking skills leave a lot to be desired, she hopes to bungle her way through the night, and though she is amused by the kitchen chaos, not everyone is impressed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Londoner Glen Wilkie hosts the second dinner party of the week in Reading, Berkshire, and is confident of victory. However, a disaster with his dessert gets the day off to a bad start, and his main course, which he has chosen to call Bambi on a Plate, leaves one guest in tears - while another flatly refuses to eat it

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mature student Richard Howse hosts the third dinner party in Reading, using a menu and set of instructions provided by his girlfriend to guide him. A treasure hunt brings out Glen Wilkie's feelings about Serine Daou, Sonya Smith dislikes some of the gluten-free food and, for the third night in a row, Sabi Phagura is served a plate of meat she will not eat

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner party in Reading sees fitness fanatic Sabi Phagura putting her healthy regimen to one side to host a bhangra-themed evening. Unfortunately, neither the traditional Indian food on the table nor the entertainment seems to impress the guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Corset-maker Serine Daou hosts the final night of the culinary competition in Reading, Berkshire, and hopes to impress with her burlesque-themed party. When the gourmet burgers she serves fail to impress, she must rely on the evening's entertainment to put her back on course for the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Rob and Jo Smith's dog-friendly B&B in Hope Mountain, north Wales. Eyebrows are raised when self-styled 'queens of clean' Steffi Stephenson and Sarah Banks find evidence of their pet hate. During an afternoon making jam, identical twins Fernando and Emilio Tundidor reveal a competitive streak. At breakfast, Denise and Alan Newman are surprisingly demanding

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Beaumont Hotel in Louth, Lincolnshire, two guests are damning about the breakfast quality, so it remains to be seen how managers Steffi Stevenson and Sarah Banks will react

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Rock House Hotel in Lynmouth, Devon, where owner Emilio Tundidor is being ably assisted by his identical twin brother Fernando

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Troy House in Painswick, Gloucestershire, where owners Alan and Denise Newman hope the guests will love their rooms, but Emilio and Fernando are on the warpath

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees the B&B owners meet up for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores

programme.title: Amanda Owen's Farming Lives
programme.desc: Amanda visits Muhsen, Elif and their three children in Pontypool south Wales to see how these self-taught farmers learned how to raise goats, sheep and cows and produce their own fuel to grow and farm vegetables.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Linden, 15, is brought to A&E having badly cut his leg while back-flipping off a shed roof onto a trampoline. As well as calling an ambulance, his friends filmed the accident on their mobile phones and happily show the clip to the staff at King's. Junior doctor Sammy looks after 88-year-old Panayiota, who has been referred to hospital with breathing difficulties. Originally from Cyprus, the patient speaks very little English and Sammy has to contact a translator to help with the diagnosis and treatment. Meanwhile, 55-year-old lorry driver Antony has lost all feeling in his left leg, and an ultrasound scan reveals he needs emergency surgery on a blocked artery to save his limb

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: It's a busy Mother's Day at south London's King's College Hospital as 23-year-old builder Jamie is rushed in by paramedics having fallen from the roof of a three-storey building, landing on a brick wall. The team performs an emergency ultrasound to determine whether he has suffered internal injuries or fractured his ribs and spine, and spot a punctured lung that needs to be reinflated. Four-month-old Weston has been brought to paediatric A&E after suffering from diarrhoea and vomiting for more than 24 hours, while doctors suspect David, 74, has had a stroke. Junior doctor Matt looks after 80-year-old Daphne, who has dislocated her replacement hip

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: Fast Justice
programme.desc: Sentinels break down a front door to find a man suspected of drug offences, and a pair from out of town are hiding a big secret

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May set out to discover if they can go motor racing for less than it costs to play golf. There's also a double helping of guests, with rock star Slash and Formula One driver Kimi Raikkonen taking to the track in Reasonably Priced Cars. Richard also gets behind the wheel of the BMW M5, which is powered by a twin-turbo V8 engine instead of the high-revving V10 of its predecessor

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history

programme.title: QI XL

He pays a visit to his favourite market in the city of Perigueux, and traces the historic connections between England and the city, which was once known as the Kingdom of Aquitaine. Inspired by his visit, he returns to the kitchen to prepare Enchaud, a traditional pot roast pork from the region, before heading towards the shores of the Mediterranean and the Cote Catalan near the Spanish border

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from London's Wembley Stadium to Milan's San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of £35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: The presenter examines how the car industry in Germany and Japan blossomed following the Second World War, becoming manufacturing giants that far outstripped the Allied nations that had defeated them. He test drives some of the vehicles Germany and Japan produced during the post-war period, as well as an assortment of other classic cars, including E-Types and Mustangs. He also reveals the sad tale of the Austin Allegro, a vehicle that had a devastating impact on the British car industry

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor tells the story of the early canal builders who struggled with the rugged terrain of England's Pennine hills. Creating a network of canals in this landscape was an major challenge, but connecting the powerhouses of Yorkshire and Lancashire was a great incentive at the time of the Industrial Revolution. Liz considers the strategic considerations and implications of this massive engineering project

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor discovers how carving up the landscape in order to build canals helped further man's understanding of the earth below. William Smith, a surveyor on the Somerset Coal Canal, discovered a way of ordering layers of rocks and eventually created the first geological map of England and Wales. His ideas about the age and formation of the earth were developed long before Darwin published his theories of evolution

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels along England's south coast from Hythe to Hastings. Along the way, he discovers a hardy breed of sheep on Romney Marsh, explores Kent's sparkling-wine industry and learns why the Victorians became obsessed with ferns

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a journey from Ayr to Skye. He begins by visiting the home town of poet Robert Burns and finds out how to make haggis. He then discovers the way in which the railway transformed the game of golf in Prestwick, and uncovers the story of the great Victorian tartan hoax in Paisley

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England in the elegant resort town of Southport, where the railways provided thousands of holidaymakers with the chance enjoy the fun of the fair. On his journey around some of the region's larger towns, the presenter uncovers the history of Victorian entrepreneurship in Wigan and the beginnings of the Industrial Revolution in Bolton, before heading to smaller Leyland to get behind the wheel of a 100-year-old commercial vehicle

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England by celebrating Victorian trade with the Preston Guild, and then heading to Rochdale to learn about a pioneering movement to improve the lives of working families. programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor recounts the story of 'canal mania' - a boom period of frenzied activity that helped develop Britain's modern financial economy, now centred in London. The new canal capitalists made money by investing and speculating in waterways used to carry fuel and goods around the country. However, not all canals were profitable and investors soon discovered that such a venture created losers as well as winners

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines the Manchester Ship Canal, hailed as the greatest engineering feat of the Victorian age. Widely regarded as troublesome outsiders who led a drunken life of ungodly debauchery, the navvies who built it toiled in a time of rising trade unionism, prompting Liz to consider how well they managed to organise themselves in campaigning for the best possible deal

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses into West Yorkshire to begin the next leg of his journey, visiting the Worth Valley and the home of the three Bronte sisters, who were early investors in the railway industry. He then heads to Oakworth to find out how its station and tracks were used in one of the most popular films ever made, and in Bradford discovers the ways in which 19th-century workers saved to buy a home. The presenter finishes in Halifax, where he learns how the railways contributed to the town's success

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tunes into the music of the mills and collieries of Victorian England by joining a brass band in Honley, West Yorkshire, before stopping off in Holmfirth to learn about a tragedy that led to a tourist boom in the town. The presenter then crosses into Derbyshire to pay homage to railway engineer George Stephenson at his resting place in Chesterfield, before concluding his journey at Chatsworth House, which was one of the first stately homes to welcome visitors by rail

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor tells the story of the people who operated the canal boats, carrying fuel and goods around the country. During the Victorian era they gained reputations for criminality, violence and drinking, but was such a reputation deserved? Liz discovers grisly canal crimes, investigates health and welfare on-board working boats, and looks at why canal children were last on the list to be offered safeguards and formal education. She reveals the campaigners who set out to tackle this injustice, including George Smith of Coalville, Leicestershire, and Sister Mary Ward of Stoke Bruerne, Northamptonshire

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor explores the heritage of the canal network. After years of decline, the inland waterways were eventually restored to become places of leisure and tranquillity. Liz visits the Pontcysyllte Aqueduct in north Wales and travels to Birmingham where canals have become catalysts for property development and urban regeneration

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A volcanic island just off Taiwan containing chilling ruins from its darkest era, and a miniature railway that lies forgotten in the woods of Arkansas

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide of 1913, Michael Portillo explores the former domain of the Habsburg monarchs, beginning in the Hungarian capital Budapest. He then travels to Austria via Bratislava in Slovakia, and in Vienna he immerses himself in pre-First World War decadence. From there he heads to Salzburg, before going on to the Salzkammergut region to visit the emperor's Austrian summer residence at Bad Ischl, where in 1914 Franz Joseph I signed a declaration that changed the course of European history

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, beginning his journey in Berlin - which at the beginning of the 20th Century was a powerhouse of science and technology. Led by his copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide of 1913, he heads west via the Harz Mountains to the industrial Ruhr Valley to learn how imperial Germany was ready for war. He then goes south along the tourist trail of the castle-studded Rhine river and ends in the Rheingau to taste the wines of its vineyards

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Following in the footsteps of early 20th-century travellers, Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to explore Switzerland, which was a favourite with Edwardian tourists. He begins in Basel, travels east to visit the industrial regions of Zurich and learns about the engineering feats needed to thread the rail network through the Alps. He takes in the striking beauty of Lake Lucerne, before ending with an ascent by train to Europe's highest station at Jungfraujoch

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to explore Holland and Belgium, before travelling to the French sector of the Western Front. He ends his journey in the Forest of Compiegne in northern France to hear how the First World War armistice was signed in a railway carriage

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo once again ventures onto the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide. He begins in Spain, where he visits the scene of an assassination attempt at a royal wedding in Madrid, before dancing with an unusual partner in Cordoba. He investigates the story behind Bizet's Carmen at a tobacco factory in Seville, learns about Winston Churchill's tense diplomatic mission to Algeciras and finishes with tales of British espionage in Gibraltar

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels through Italy from Turin to Venice.Along the way, he recreates a scene from the Michael Caine film The Italian Job on a Fiat test track and takes a trip in a seaplane to investigate the early 20th-century British love affair with Lake Como. In Verona, he visits the house used to attract Edwardian tourists to the alleged setting of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and finds a microcosm of pre-First World War Europe at the Venice Biennale art exhibition

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Manchester, voiceover artist and film extra Matt cooks up a Jewish Friday night supper, including his mum's traditional chicken soup

programme.desc: Budding author and mum-of-five Cleona is next to host in Manchester, hoping a menu based on her Jamaican roots will get her guests onside

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Documentary continuing the real-life adventures of property expert Sarah Beeny, her husband Graham Swift and their four sons after quitting their lives in London to start anew at a former dairy farm in Somerset. The shell of their mini mansion is built but the home is far from ready, and they are tackling the interior one room at a time. First up is the grand hallway - but first the downstairs needs a concrete floor. Away from the build, Sarah is adding a second beehive and family dog Maple has a surprise in store

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels
programme.desc: In New York, the TWA Hotel is close by the John F Kennedy International Airport. Its interiors hark back to the spirit of the 1960s jet age, but with a 21st-century twist. Here, visitors can check in at the old baggage check and enjoy dining in what used to be an airport lounge. In Finnish Lapland, visitors to the snow-capped forest of the Urho Kekkonen National Park can spend a night sleeping under the stars at the Kakslauttanen Arctic Resort. This getaway boasts 65 state-of-the-art, arctic-resistant glass igloos. There are also visits to unique and unusual hotels in Canada and Scotland

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with Catherine and Nigel four years after their first visit when they helped them decide what to do with their home in Larne, Northern Ireland. Catherine wanted to move from the disjointed small roomed bungalow in an isolated location but Nigel, who didn't want to buy the property in the first place, was in love with their large garden with stunning views. While Phil took the pair to see some impressive but affordable houses, Kirstie came up with a plan to repurpose their space. Now they're back to see if the pair stuck to their decision

programme.title: Infinite (2021)
programme.desc: A man who finds himself troubled by memories that are not his and developing skills he never learned is recruited by a mysterious organisation. The members of this group have learned to access the experiences of their past lives, but one has gone rogue, and must be stopped in his efforts to end the cycle of reincarnation by destroying all human life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: 46 year-old Sara is rushed in after a car crash with serious head and chest injuries, and 54 year-old Simon comes in after falling off his bike on his way to buy a helmet. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Building delays leave a trio of friends in limbo as they plan to open a cocktail bar in Spain, while in France, B&Bers attempt to turn an old farmhouse into holiday accommodation

programme.desc: The Spanish bar owners become cocktail waiters and work on the French farmhouse progresses under a tight schedule. In Alicante, a luxury wedding venue suffers a setback

programme.desc: Sarah and Graham recruit a band of workers to begin Covid-safe renovation work after a month's pause in the project. programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country

programme.desc: Great British Bake Off star Prue Leith and her son Danny Kruger investigate the subject of assisted dying. The mother-and-son duo travel to Canada and the US to get a greater understanding of the topic, and discuss their findings en route. As patron of the pressure group Dignity in Dying, Prue is campaigning for British law to be changed. However, Conservative MP Danny, Chair of Dying Well, is keen to prevent any change to existing circumstances. It remains to be seen whether what they discover in the making of this documentary tempers their attitudes

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Blandings
programme.desc: Hannibal Didcot is bullying Clarence over a fake painting, while Connie is keen for the irascible lord to propose to her new best friend, wealthy American Vanessa Polk. Galahad and Freddie, however, believe this fair maiden should be spared such a fate and set out to prevent the match. Period comedy based on the stories by PG Wodehouse, starring Timothy Spall and Jennifer Saunders, with guest appearances by John Sessions, Julian Rhind-Tutt and Daisy Beaumont

programme.desc: A gambler visits a ranch owned by the mother of four infamous outlaw brothers. Western, with Clark Gable, Eleanor Parker and Jo Van Fleet

Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Ian Hunter, David Lodge and John Le Mesurier

programme.desc: Six train robbers hide from the law in a deserted monastery off the Cornish coast, where disguising themselves as monks proves the perfect way of lying low while carrying on with various criminal activities. Comedy, with Ronald Fraser, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Cribbins, Wilfrid Brambell and Davy Kaye

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions.
